titleproper.value:
Preliminary Inventory to the Feminist Organization for Communication, Action and Service (FOCAS) Records
                    <num>TAM.234</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T19:06-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Feminist Organization for Communication, Action and Service (FOCAS) Records

p.value:
Open for research without restrictions. 
                <emph render="bold">NOTE: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use.</emph>

The Feminist Organization for Communitcation, Action and Service (FOCAS), a New York City-based feminist organization founded ca. 1971 by women formerly active in the Women's Strike Coalition, an initiative of the Socialist Workers Party, a Trotskyist group, was active throughout the 1970s, and sought to create coalitions with other women's groups, initiate actions, hold forums and disseminate information. FOCAS published a newsletter, 
                <emph render="italic">Majority Report</emph> (1971-1978), a complete run of which is held by the Tamiment Library. The collection principally contains research files and files on other feminist organizations, as well as administrative records, including files relating to the publication of 
                <emph render="italic">Majority Report</emph>, and files on various FOCAS activities. In addition to the box-level description of this unprocessed collection, below, a five page appraisal report on the collection which describes its contents and the history and activities of FOCAS, is available at the Library. 
                <emph render="bold">NOTE: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use.</emph> PLEASE DIRECT FURTHER INQUIRIES TO: tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu
